description.plain:
Mario Mims (born May 17, 1981), better known by his stage name Yo Gotti, is an American rapper. He hails from the northern side of Memphis, Tennessee.

In 2000, Gotti released his debut album From Da Dope Game 2 Da Rap Game. He went on to release Self-Explanatory (2001), Life (2003), Back 2 da Basics (2006), Live from the Kitchen (2012) and I Am (2013)

songs.full_title: Rake It Up by Yo Gotti (Ft. Nicki Minaj)
songs.title: Rake It Up

description.plain:
On “Rake It Up,” both Nicki Minaj and Yo Gotti talk about their rap lifestyles and how to handle rap feuds. Nicki also addresses her beef with Remy Ma—the day before the song dropped, Nicki tweeted:

I love that Gotti gave you boys the dos & dont’s on the [first] verse of this song.
We don’t beef on social sites, we just hit our target.

“Rake It Up” was announced as a single release but ended up being accompanied by eight more songs when Gotti Made-It dropped on Tidal and Vevo on June 2nd. Prior to the release, Nicki gave her fans a sneak-peak of her verse on social media.

songs.full_title: Down in the DM by Yo Gotti
songs.title: Down in the DM

description.plain:
Memphis rapper Yo Gotti writes the playbook for flirting with women via Instagram’s Direct Message function (a.k.a. The DM). There’s celebrity nudes in his inbox, he’s got a keyboard full of eye emoji, and he’s ready to risk it all for his #WCW, Angela Simmons.

“Down In The DM” is a minimalist, bass-heavy, synth-and-808 hip-hop song that was produced by Florida-based musicians Ben Billions and Schife Karbeen. The lyrics, with their mix of sex and technology, follow in the tradition of Zapp’s “Computer Love,” Three 6 Mafia’s “2-Way Freak,” and Trey Songz’s “LOL :).”

The song was released on Gotti’s independent mixtape The Return in September 2015, and then released by Epic Records as a single on October 25, 2015. Rick Ross remixed “Down In The DM” on October 31 as part of his #RenzelRemixes series. Yo Gotti followed it up with his own remix on February 3rd, 2016, which featured a new verse from A-List rapper Nicki Minaj.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lOkBIx-2R1Y

songs.full_title: Cold Blood by Yo Gotti (Ft. Canei Finch & J. Cole)
songs.title: Cold Blood
songs.title_with_featured: Cold Blood (Ft. Canei Finch & J. Cole)

description.plain:
In “Cold Blood,” Yo Gotti enlists J. Cole and Canei Finch to touch on poverty and growing up in a poverty-stricken neighborhood.

With his guest features rubbing off a soulful vibe, Yo Gotti takes a more sensitive approach to his street rhymes.

On February 5th, 2014, Gotti released the visuals which see Cole and Gotti remembering their lost ones in the hood.

songs.full_title: Rihanna by Yo Gotti (Ft. Young Thug)
songs.title: Rihanna

description.plain:
This song dropped as a promotional single for Yo Gotti’s 2015 album The Art of Hustle, inspired by Sun Tzu’s “The Art of War.”

Even though the song is named after pop superstar Rihanna, Gotti also name drops the likes of Madonna, Taylor Swift, Kylie Jenner, Hannah Montana & Miley Cyrus, Katy Perry and Alicia Keys throughout.

The song is an ode to the hustler lifestyle. Madonna represents “white girl,” otherwise known as cocaine, while Rihanna seems to be Gotti’s trap queen.



On August 3, 2015, the official music video followed. It stars Thugger, Gotti and a whole host of women. Also it includes a cameo by Boosie Badazz.

songs.title: Castro
songs.title_with_featured: Castro (Ft. 2 Chainz, Big Sean, Kanye West & Quavo)

description.plain:
“Castro” is a song where Yo Gotti, Quavo, Big Sean, Kanye West and 2 Chainz compare themselves to the 16th Prime Minster and 17th President of Cuba, Fidel Castro. The politician was known for the Cuban Missile Crisis and advancing Socialism in Cuba, among others. Castro passed away just over two weeks before the release of “Castro.”

This is the second time Yo Gotti, Kanye West, Quavo, Big Sean and 2 Chainz have all collaborated. They appeared on the Cruel Winter cut “Champions,” alongside Travis Scott, Gucci Mane & Desiigner.
